main event: Military radar detected an unidentified object rapidly ascending from 70,000 ft to 105,000 ft over Kirksville, Missouri on September 28, 1960.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 45 seconds before the object disappeared off the radar scope., The object was picked up by ground radar as a normal return but was painted at an altitude of 70,000 ft., No similar sightings were reported from other radar stations in the area., The conditions of air mixing with cold dry air may have contributed to the radar effect observed., The report mentioned two reliable operators, Donald L. Mitchell and Walter W. Yount, who observed the radar return.
witness description: Donald L. Mitchell, A/3C and Walter W. Yount, A/2C, both reliable radar operators
